publication.title: A Collaborative Informatics Infrastructure for Multi-Scale Science
publication.authors: james d. myers,thomas c. allison,sandra bittner,brett t. didier,michael frenklach,william h. green jr.,yen-ling ho,john c. hewson,wendy s. koegler,carina lansing,david leahy,renata mccoy,michael minkoff,sandeep nijsure,gregor von laszewski,david montoya,luwi oluwole,carmen m. pancerella,reinhardt pinzon,william pitz,larry a. rahn,branko ruscic,karen schuchardt,eric g. stephan,al wagner,theresa l. windus,christine l. yang
publication.abstract: The Collaboratory for Multi-scale Chemical Science (CMCS) is developing a powerful informatics- based approach to synthesizing multi-scale information to support a systems-based research approach and is applying it in support of combustion research. An open source multi-scale informatics toolkit is being developed that addresses a number of issues core to the emerging concept of knowledge grids including provenance tracking and
